(6/6) Find out more information here: https://t.co/A0RuZsNPfF

(5/6) This is a particularly important decision at a time when COVID is still spreading in Wales. 

The clinical risk priority order for deployment of the vaccines remains unchanged and applies to both vaccines now available. Both are very effective vaccines.

(4/6) If you have received your first dose, your health board will contact you accordingly to rearrange your appointment within this timescale. Please do not phone your health board, they will be in touch with you.

(3/6) Practically this does mean that second doses will be delayed but everyone receiving the vaccine will still receive their second dose up to 12 weeks after the first dose, for longer term protection

(2/6) More first doses will allow us to offer protection from COVID-19 to more people in the priority groups more quickly and will ultimately save lives. JCVI advise a single dose of vaccine offers high levels of short-term protection.

(1/6) The Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI) has recommended that as many people on the JCVI priority list as possible should be offered a first vaccine dose as the initial priority. This decision has been adopted in Wales. https://t.co/hLEYut7M8U
